title: What are examples of outsourcing? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a lot of examples of outsourcing companies. I can enumerate some below and discuss them as much as I can: Professional service outsourcing This is the most common and well-known type of outsourcing services since its function is to outsource employees from other countries to do the complicated tasks of the business. This type of service saves a massive amount of money on overhead. The most outsourced services are skill specific such as Information technologies, legal and accounting. Manufacturing outsourcing This is the most pushed towards type. The cost of making your own products locally is significantly high. Paying the factory workers and raw material cost is massive. A typical example is a car manufacturing company that can decide to contract an outsourcing service for making and installing windows in their automobiles. The biggest advantage that comes from using manufacturing outsourcing service is cost saving, plus decreased assembling time. However, there are also some concerns such as quality issues and interception of the product time. Process-Specific Outsourcing An outsourcing service can also be identified to an internal procedure or unique process. This is an acceptable and suitable option for service organizations where the specific areas of the service can be contracted to another organization, so that the business can concentrate on the core areas of the service. A typical example is a bakery company; here, the delivery aspect of the business can be outsourced to a distribution company, providing it with customer contacts, delivery contacts as well as costs. Operational Outsourcing Service This type of outsourcing service is normally affiliated with the manufacturing industry. That is because there is an operational tasks and steps required to be taken for the end result to be achieved properly. For example, the equipment repairs and machine maintenance is very commonly outsourced to a 3rd party that specializes in such tasks. Hope this answer may help you guys to understand the differences of the types of outsourcing.

Today, companies and businesses can practically outsourcing any business function they want to. I’ve put them into groups for easier explanation: Professional outsourcing Professional outsourcing significantly reduces a company’s overhead costs, because this kind of outsourcing lets companies gain access to high quality resources while paying only for the services used. Here are the business functions under professional outsourcing: IT functions - network management, website or software development, data warehousingBusiness process and HR - payment processing, recruitment, inbound and outbound sales, trading and marketing, human resourcesFinance - bookkeeping, tax management, invoicingSales and marketing - marketing communicationsManufacturing outsourcing This type of outsourcing primarily means the transferring of production or manufacture-related jobs to expert third parties to save on human capital, time and expenses. Popular examples of tasks outsourced are those in production of goods and car manufacture. As not all companies have the means to continuously upgrade their equipment and their process, manufacturing outsourcing helps these companies deliver their products to stay competitive in the market. Process-specific outsourcing This kind of outsourcing refers to the outsourcing of a specific process or procedure. It’s becoming a popular choice for companies to outsource their specific operation-related aspects to other companies that specialise in that service. Ex: A bakery outsourcing their deliveries to courier companies In our example above, the outsourced courier company is now tasked with having delivery timelines, customer contacts and costs, etc. This allows the company to focus on its strength as they reduce costs and time. Operational outsourcing service This type of outsourcing is common in the manufacturing industry, but unlike the previous type, this involves a different set of tasks: Equipment repairsMachine maintenanceFacilities managementInstallationIf you’re looking to outsource your development needs, maybe my company Cloud Employee can help! We’re a UK-managed IT outsourcing company in the Philippines providing services to startups and SMEs from Western countries like the UK, the US, and Australia. We’re commonly able to provide talented tech talents to our clients in as fast as 2-4 weeks without the risks of traditional outsourcing. Want to know more? Feel free to send us a message for your enquiries. Our business model helps companies save up to 65% against hiring locally.
